The histone tails not only contact the DNA wrapped around the histone octamer, but also bind to linker DNA as well as  the acidic patches of the neighboring nucleosomes. These interactions between histone tails and DNA may play critical roles in the formation of higher-order chromatin especially heterochromatin. Histone H1 is known to be enriched in heterochromatin and methylation of Histone 3 tail at Lysine 9 (H3K9 me)  is important for the interaction of heterochromatin protein complex in these region.
